title: Bots
body:
I am getting very frustrated with the amount of bots I am playing with. Some games I am the only human player.

I have been reporting bots when I encounter them as they are easy to spot (feeding, diving, not communicating, not buying etc....)

I think it has become such a problem that when you report players there needs to be a "this player is a bot" option.

I have noticed that there have been multiple threads about this in the past couple of years, but the problem persists and is getting worse.

I'm starting to miss the toxic players I used to play with, at least they weren't bots.

replies.body: Sick of bots too!! They need perma-banning, maybe ban their IP address as well.
There's so many in ARAM and Co-op vs AI games.

At this point I'm starting to wonder if it actually is possible to detect some of these guys. Riot's recently opened applications for [Anti-cheat analysts](http://www.riotgames.com/careers/228983), which might be a good sign there's a solution coming. But realistically it's still unlikely we'll see anymore than a 30% - 40% reduction in the amount of bots, which would still leave a lot of bots left.

The only solution that would kill the bots for good for sure is an official smurfing service. But obviously there's some big downsides to that, and it looks like [Riot's pretty divided on the issue](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/lets-talk-smurfs-snow-and-bans-ask-riot).

I'm usually pretty decisive this kind of stuff, but TBH I'm not really sure what the best solution is in this case :P
Botting is a script, it is 100% detectable, just like scripting, riot just doesn't give a fuck.

I've seen bot programs which act as an entirely separate program (they're fairly common actually), they process simple information on the screen and then control the mouse to move around. It never touches the actual game files which makes it essentially impossible to detect. Even just coding your scripts in ring0 makes detecting you so much harder.

Every game company struggles with this for a reason, it's really not that straightforward. If you're not realistic when making demands like this, it doesn't really help anyone TBH.

That's good new that they are hiring anti-cheat analysts, I'd apply for this job if it were in Oceania.

And yes the only defence to some forms of cheating is good old human logic. For example, a simple example is using that fact that a player's mouse cannot be in two or more places at the same time.

Yeap, you're right. If Riot was given the ability to actually scan your whole computer and HDD, they could probably put an end to all scripting (and detect weird anomalies like a double mouse).

But of course that's where things can get complicated with privacy laws, I believe in the EU there's all kinds of [strict regulations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Protection_Directive) against stuff like that. I'd also wonder how frequent scans would get done without lagging out anyone with an average/low end CPU.

When I consider all that, I think the _'official smurfing service'_ seems like a more realistic solution, but we could end up with more problems than before if it was implemented.
Not regularly.  Reckon I've seen 3 in my years of play. But suspect they might be more prevalent in lower levels as accounts are pushed to 30 and sold. Not basing that on any evidence just gut feel.
You're probably right, I'm only low level and encounter bots EVERY game. Sometimes there aren't ANY human players except me.
Same here, over it. Riot do something!!

The purpose of the bots are to get an account to level 30 (and sell the account) so level 30's shouldn't encounter them often or at all but it is a problem for level 29's and below. Pretty sure it's illegal to bot accounts as well. I think Riot should do something about it but for most of the playerbase this is an issue they have never seen or did when leveling so I don't think Riot will do much about it unfortunately.
Been lv 30 for a long time now and in the last 2 weeks I've played with nothing but bots.
Yep same here. Ranked play is your only safe bet atm to avoid this plague.
